meanings.definition: To receive a degree or diploma from a school or university.
meanings.sent1: She will be graduating from college next month.
meanings.sent2: He is graduating with honors this year.
meanings.sent3: The cat is graduating from obedience school.
meanings.sent4: The sun is like a student graduating from the sky every evening.
meanings.sent5: The moment of graduating is a culmination of years of hard work.

meanings.definition: To mark or divide into degrees or other proportionate divisions.
meanings.sent1: The thermometer is graduating the temperature in increments.
meanings.sent2: The ruler is used to graduating lengths accurately.
meanings.sent3: The chef is graduating the ingredients for the recipe.
meanings.sent4: The colors in the sky are graduating from light to dark.
meanings.sent5: The artist is graduating the shades of blue in the painting.

meanings.definition: To pass from one stage to another in a process of change or development.
meanings.sent1: The caterpillar is gradually graduating into a butterfly.
meanings.sent2: The project is slowly graduating towards completion.
meanings.sent3: The joke is graduating from funny to hilarious.
meanings.sent4: The river is like time, constantly graduating towards the ocean.
meanings.sent5: The seed is graduating into a plant with each passing day.
